_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. The Facility Policy

The owners, management, and employees of Ag Processing Inc Refinery are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of hydrogen. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with local fire departments, and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information

The primary activity at Ag Processing Inc Refinery is the refining of soybean oils. Hydrogen is used to hydrogenate the oil to produce vegetable oils with specific properties and characteristics. The maximum quantity of hydrogen stored is 26,600 pounds.

3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility has implementated the required provisions of the Program Level 1 RMP. The facility has also developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program that covers this process, as well as other applicable regulations.

4. The Five-Year Accident History

This RMP is being submitted to reflect an increase in storage quantity that will exceed the RMP threshold reporting limit. The process has been in service since January 2001 at quantities less than the threshold quantity, and there have been no accidental releases of hydrogen in the past five years that;
     - have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility;
     - have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

5. The Emergency Response Program

The facility has:
     a.  A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38.
     b.  Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III ( EPCRA ).
     c.  A written emergency response plan that includes the required elements. The plan has recently been reviewed, and employees have recently been trained.
     d.  A Spill Prevention Control and

Countermeasure Plan, in accordance with EPA regulations, 40 CFR 112.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
